Topic.Title: Since Global Warming has been mentioned earlier, there are those who blieve

Message.Msg: According to James Hansen from 2009 Obama is too late: ____________________________________________ 'President 'has four years to save Earth' US must take the lead to avert eco-disaster Robin McKie in New York The Observer, Saturday 17 January 2009 Barack Obama has only four years to save the world. That is the stark assessment of Nasa scientist and leading climate expert Jim Hansen who last week warned only urgent action by the new president could halt the devastating climate change that now threatens Earth. Crucially, that action will have to be taken within Obama's first administration, he added. _____________________________________________ Obama doesn't have a clue about climate change as his understanding of math and physics is at a 7th grade level which he announced on national TV. If Obama was intelligent enough to calculate the Earth's radiation budget and then calculate the amount of heat content reduction in the oceans that that USA CO2 cuts would make, he would know that he can do nothing that would have any significant impact on a global scale. There are two major areas where man is increasing CO2, energy production and land use change. Land use change is contributing as much or more CO2 as is energy production but is ignored because it is the poor and developing countries that are destroying forests and altering land to produce these emissions rather than the rich developed countries like the USA. So it is too late as the contribution of global CO2 emissions for the USA is only about 7% when energy production and land use change are considered included in the calculation. Worse yet s the fact that the 165 coal plants aleady scheduled to be shut down in the USA by 2017 will do nothing to offset the 1200 new larger coal plants that are being built by 2017 by the China and India. The measly 1 Gt per year of CO2 that the USA cuts by 2020 will be replaced and added to by Asian Pacific countries to the tune of 15Gt per year by 2020. Even a president as dumb at math as Obama is can figure out that he's deluding himself and the public in suggesting that the USA can make any meaningful reduction in CO2 in order to prevent catastrophic warming.

"LBJ had Vietnam and got 58000 mens names scratched on a black slab ..." As usual, Sparty, you jump to rehtorical conclusions, overlooking facts. One internet source says the were 35,486 U.S. military deaths in VN from 1961-68 and 20,501 from 1969 through 1972. The total doesn't add up to 58,272, in part because names were added after the page I cite was created; or because 1961-65 deaths are lumped together; certainly there were deaths before 1961 -- the earliest casualty on the wall is June 8, 1956; perhaps there were deaths after 1972. But we don't need to argue about a 2,200-death discrepancy. My POINT is that you launch off without considering Nixon's "Bag." There's an above-average chance a trained person can talk just about anyone out of suicide. I recenly saw a story about a night watchman/patrolman/something who had stopped dozens of jumpers off the Golden Gate. The veterans administration runs a hot line for service members or veterans to talk (about anything) 24/7. I haven't found any details on their "success" rate, but they keep at it. The high success rate has led to the philosophy (probably patronizing) that most suicide attemps are just a "cry for help." Of course you'll never stop someone who's convinced they have to do it, but pills or exhaust or jumping takes way more committment than simply holding the gun in your mouth and pulling the trigger. I don't know why we're arguing this point, since most of this is done with handguns or shotguns, and I've not heard of anyone planning to restrict ownership of those -- unless you have been to a doc (who flagged you in the system) and THEN try to purchase a gun to accomplish it.

Message.Title: Make no mistake. We are Greece.
Message.Msg: The free food handout in Athens began peacefully as hundreds of Greeks lined up in advance outside the agriculture ministry, where protesting farmers laid out tables piled high with produce, giving away 50 metric tonnes (55.11 tons) of produce in under two hours. Tensions flared when the stalls ran out of produce and dozens of people – some carrying small children – rushed to a truck and shoved each other out of the way in the competition for what was left. One man was treated for injuries after being trampled when he fell to the ground in the commotion. “I never imagined that I would end up here,” said Panagiota Petropoulos, 65, who struggles to get by on her 530-euro monthly pension while paying 300 euros in rent. “I can’t afford anything, not even at the fruit market. Everything is expensive, prices of everything are going up while our income is going down and there are no jobs.” Desperation, sadness, poverty, disbelief – these are the horrors that await the unprepared. While European (and U.S.) officials would have us believe they’ve mitigated the crisis in Greece, the fact is that this experiment in centralized governance is, in its entirety,on the brink of collapse. We’ve chronicled the desperate situation in Greece for the last few years. Personal accounts from some of our readers express their fear and uncertainty as political and socioeconomic conditions have deteriorated. Shortages of life savings medicines and food have led to widespread riots and looting. Food has become so expensive in Greece that it has become unattainable for many, prompting the Greek government to authorize grocery retailers to sell expired food at discounted prices. On a national level, Greece’s manipulation of economic health numbers and their ability to repay loans has left them unable to meet their financial obligations and has led to talks of their exit from the Euro, a move that has the potential to destroy the European currency system altogether. The debts have gotten so high that the country faced the possibility of a complete collapse of their power and gas infrastructure when local utility companies were unable to settle their agreements with regional suppliers – an effect caused by their customers’ inability to pay their monthly bills. This is what it looks like when a system collapses. Sometimes it happens overnight in a waterfall event. In the case of Greece, a country that has the backing of the world’s two largest central banks, it’s been a slow but steady process of grinding down all aspects of life. A similar grinding down should be apparent in other Western nations, namely the United States, where we’ve seen employment decline unabated over the last decade and tens of millions of people added to government funded social safety nets like food assistance and disability. Make no mistake. We are Greece.

Topic.Title: Okay, here's your #$%$? moment of the day

Message.Msg: Chad Campbell didn't do any research Hooz because he didn't know that Seagal is the real deal and certified as as an international martial arts master and teacher. Unlike moron politicians who can BS their way through life you have to fight to advance in martial arts to prove that your fighting skills meet the requirements to advance in rank. The teaching certification process for martial arts is extremely challenging.

It looks inevitable to a lot of people that lines in the sand will be drawn. Insensitivity to others. Anger towards others because people believe others are responsible for their hardships. More willingness to except violence as a solution. consumption of hard drugs by millions over long periods. Breakdown of the family. Failing to take responsibility for ones own future. Increased Liberal Media violence in tv and movies. Increase in violent roving bands of blacks looking to take their anger out against whites. Loss in faith and compassion. America is almost ripe for some major type of upheavel beginning in the inner cities and spreading out towards the suburbs. America is a tinder box ready to catch fire. Obama and his socialist collaborators will be there to pick up the pieces. The president's best friend, Bill Ayers, has been anticipating this moment for 50 years. It may not be here tomorrow or the next day but, just the same, it's time is approaching.
